page.title: 01GAZETTEER OF IXWORTH
page.content: Ixworth is a small, rural village of 1410 inhabitants, situated on the A143 and A1088 roads 7 miles north-east of Bury St.Edmunds and 12 north-west of Thetford. The two roads converge to become one long, single high street, bordered by 15/16th C houses.A by-pass is under construction. The river Blackbourn flows in from ESE and out northwards. The church is 12th century and later 15th C tower.The village has 3 pubs,a primary & middle school (115 & 402 pupils),post office, doctors' surgery,fire & police stations,library old-peoples'homes and a hall used by 14 organisations. There is a monthly newsletter. The village is surrounded by fertile agricultural land: barley and sugar-beet being the main crops with dairy herds and lambs grazing. There are regular bus services to Bury St.Edmunds and one to London each day.
